description.raw:
Add the scoring plugin that will be used for Qualification.  The plugin is loaded in each of the `qual_task_[i].world` files, configured to write score data to `/tmp/qual_task_[i].score.log.

To test it:

* launch a qual world (e.g., `roslaunch atlas_utils qual_task_1.launch`)
* watch the score file (e.g., `tail -f /tmp/qual_task_1/score.log`)

For Q1, Q3, and Q4:

* drag/walk the robot through gates; you should see the completionScore value in the log file increment only when passing through the next gate, and only when going through it in the right direction
* drop/abuse the robot; when large acceleration is detected, you should see the falls value in the log file increment

For Q2:

* put the drill in the bin; you should see the completionScore value in the log file increment only when the drill enters the bin
* same fall behavior as for the others
description.html:
Add the scoring plugin that will be used for Qualification. The plugin is loaded in each of the qual_task_[i].world files, configured to write score data to `/tmp/qual_task_[i].score.log.

To test it:

  • launch a qual world (e.g., roslaunch atlas_utils qual_task_1.launch)
  • watch the score file (e.g., tail -f /tmp/qual_task_1/score.log)

For Q1, Q3, and Q4:

  • drag/walk the robot through gates; you should see the completionScore value in the log file increment only when passing through the next gate, and only when going through it in the right direction
  • drop/abuse the robot; when large acceleration is detected, you should see the falls value in the log file increment

For Q2:

  • put the drill in the bin; you should see the completionScore value in the log file increment only when the drill enters the bin
  • same fall behavior as for the others
